commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Oh, Mifune?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Oh, it is. Shioriko Mifune! Are you here to keep an eye on us?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: No, the rooftop is a communal space. I believe I also have the right to be here.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: O-Of course.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: What are all of you doing here?

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: The weather's nice, so we thought it'd feel good to practice out in the open. The club introductions are coming up soon, too.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: *Sigh*

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Um, is everything all right?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Everything's fine.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Is something down there?

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Hmm, all of the sports clubs are hard at practice. The wind instrument club is running laps, too.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: You're just silently standing there with a sad look on your face. There must be a reason why.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I have nothing to say to... Actually, you all may be the best people to ask about this matter.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: What? I'm kind of scared. Rina-chan Board says, "Tremble."

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: We'll try our best to give you an answer.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: How are you all okay with doing something so useless?

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Wow, that's pretty harsh! Are you saying the school idol club is a waste of time?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: No, to be more precise, I'm saying that many of the things you do are useless, including the school idol club.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Is this because you're bothered by what we talked about during the club introductions meeting?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I'm embarrassed to admit it, but yes.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Oh, you mentioned there was a lot of disagreement over the club introduction plan.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I want prospective students to see each club's merits in an easy-to-understand fashion.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Accordingly, I came up with a club introduction format and asked each club to follow it.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: However, every club wanted to handle their introductions in their own way and rejected my proposal.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: I don't think you should force anything on them.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Rinako is right!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Why? I simply wish to present information that makes it easier for prospective students to come to a decision.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Why? Because...

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Mifune, do you really not know?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I do not.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: No one is taking the club introductions seriously, and that makes it difficult to emphasize their club's strengths and merits.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I do not think that is an appropriate way to introduce a club.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: If everyone followed my plan, they would efficiently gain new members who achieve good results. So I do not understand why they prefer their own pointless club introductions.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: It is incomprehensible to me. I cannot persuade anyone to do it my way if I cannot understand why they prefer their way in the first place.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: That is why I want to know why everyone wants to do their own club introductions. If we cannot all get on the same page, we may even have to cancel the school tour.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Cancel? Huh? Is it okay to cancel it?!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Of course not. However, at this rate, we would be showing something imperfect to prospective students. That would only serve to make them lose their trust in us.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I would rather cancel the school tour than have that happen. That is all.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: No, no. If you cancel it, what will happen to our live show?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: It would be canceled too, of course.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: No fair! We're already super fired up about it, so that's going to be a problem for us.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I'm the one with a problem. And unlike yours, mine has to do with the operation of this school.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: You keep talking about the worst-case scenario, but nothing's been decided yet, right?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: That is true, but with the way things are going, the probability that it will come to that is high.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Isn't there anything you can do?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: If there was, I would have done it by now. I am extremely reluctant to cancel the school tour, but there are some things I simply cannot allow.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I have been patiently negotiating up until now, but to tell you the truth, I no longer know what to do.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: It's unlike you to be this discouraged.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I wouldn't say I'm discouraged.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Hey, can't we do something?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yeah. It'd be bad for us if everything got canceled.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Hey, everyone, why don't we help Mifune so our live show can go on?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Whaaat?!

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: This is too sudden.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Um, I'd like to help. I was once the student council president after all. We must make sure the club introductions...that the school tour is a success.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Hmm, I think it's a good idea, too. Besides, I want to put on our live show and increase our popularity in preparation for the School Idol Festival!

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Well, it's certainly a give-and-take.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I'm sorry. Things are moving so quickly, I'm not sure I follow. I did say I had a question for you all, but I never asked for your help.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Aren't you in trouble, though?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I suppose I am, but...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: We also want the club introductions to go well. So let's work together.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Besides, we know where the other clubs are coming from for the most part. So I think we'll be able to explain how they feel to you.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Once you know that, you'll be able to come up with countermeasures like persuading everyone or changing your method. What do you say?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Are you sure?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: The student council must have their hands full with the school tour. So let us help. Honestly, there isn't much time left, right?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: That is true, but...

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Perhaps you're right. Since you claim to know how the other clubs are feeling, learning from you is probably the best strategy for now.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Normally, I would prefer to tackle this on my own, but I cannot afford to be obstinate under these circumstances.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: My main priority right now is ensuring that the school tour is a success. Thank you for the offer. I will be counting on you.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yeah. We'll make sure the school tour's a success no matter what!

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Yes, of course.
